title: Are there any unsafe areas to avoid in Nashville? - Quora
tags: Visiting and Travel in Nashville, TN

response.answer_text: If you’re asking about high-crime areas, every city has high crime areas… Nashville is no different. If it’s a specific area you’re talking about, I would avoid Lower Broadway in downtown Nashville. When it is not blocked off for some country music awards show (seems like there’s one every other week—-makes you wonder when country music singers ever find time to record songs in the studios), in the day time, the tourists are practically walking in the middle of the streets…. at night, the street tricks and homeless are out from Lower Broadway back to Vanderbilt University ready to rob you or pick your pocket.

There are all sorts of questions I would want to ask to provide context. If you go out in popular neighborhoods, you should mostly be good. There are parts of East Nashville that might be dicey around 11pm or beyond. But those are mostly not Five Points. And I suppose there are parts of Downtown that can be dicey, but there’s a police station for tourist and other security right on Broadway for that very purpose. Here are a couple suggestions: You can look at a zip code online.You can ask a real estate agent.

Bordeaux, Trinity Lane Area, Jefferson St. near Fisk University and Tennessee State University. Dickerson Pike. Murfreesboro Rd. Close to Downtown. Nolensville Rd. Close to Downtown. Gallatin Pike near Inglewood and Madison areas. These are some off the top of my head.
